definition: to give a supercilious look/roll of the eyes
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to roll one's eyes
thankless wretch/an ingrate
white of the eye
(bird species of China) white-eyed river martin (Pseudochelidon sirintarae)
erhua variant of 白眼珠[bai2 yan3 zhu1]
(bird species of China) white-eyed buzzard (Butastur teesa)

sentences.english: I rolled my eyes at them because they just gossiped about me.
sentences.chinese: 长官，她刚才朝我们翻了个白眼。

sentences.english: The cold, pale sunlight fell on their gloomy faces, long hair and lusterless eyes.
sentences.chinese: 冷淡的阳关照著他们的愁眉苦脸和长发白眼。

sentences.english: Handsome men are always at an advantage and never discriminated against.
sentences.chinese: 英俊的男士永远占有优势，且从不遭受职场白眼。

sentences.english: See a 69 at the end, and you’re guaranteed to roll your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 从头到尾都是6和9，我保证你会翻白眼。

sentences.english: And no eye-rolling, Dr. Gutting said.

sentences.chinese: 听到这你就翻白眼了，对吗？

sentences.english: In riot-torn districts, the police were widely hated.
sentences.chinese: 受到骚乱影响的社区，警察处处遭遇白眼。

sentences.english: Students should never smack their lips, roll theirs eyes, or show disrespect with gestures.
sentences.chinese: 孩子不能做咂嘴，翻白眼或者其他不尊重他人的举动。

sentences.english: The cold, pale sunlight fell on their and lusterless eyes.
sentences.chinese: 冷淡的阳光照着他们和长发白眼。

sentences.english: He showed the whites of his eyes and seemed to have ceased breathing.
sentences.chinese: 他翻白眼，似乎已经停止了呼吸。

sentences.english: That black eye that Joe got last night should cure him of minding other people's business.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚乔遭到白眼，应该治治他那种愿管别人事的毛病。

sentences.english: Cat lovers and the pet averse will just roll their eyes at such dogophilia.
sentences.chinese: 爱猫者和厌恶宠物者对这种亲狗症只能翻翻白眼而已。

sentences.english: Night gives you a black eye, but you use it rolling his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 黑夜给了你黑色的眼睛，你却用它翻白眼。

sentences.english: Besides, it can also whiten the skin around eyes, smooth away dark eye circles.
sentences.chinese: 同时润白眼部皮肤，淡化黑眼圈。

sentences.english: Her words as expected and again the Mao surname is a cold stare.
sentences.chinese: 她的话不出所料的又得了甑氏一个白眼。

definition: to roll one's eyes
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to sneer at
to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
to mumble to oneself
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to mutter/to mumble complaints/to grumble
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
to groan/to snort/to hum/to croon/humph!
silent curse or disagreement/unspoken criticism
to mock/to ridicule
